column4: dct:DESCRIPTION
A value (often predetermined) that specifies an ordered quantile of a) the cumulative distribution function of a random variable or b) the observations in a sample in units of percent.
The event on which a conditional probability depends.  Points to a dichotomous variable.
A human-readable description of a dichotomous event to which a probability can be assigned
The class of probability forecasts that can be represented by a categorical distribution
Breakpoints that divide a) the range of the probability distribution of a random variable or b) the observations in a sample into contiguous intervals with equal probabilities.
Lower bound of an interval
Cumulative Distribution Function
A procedure used to form categories.  The method must unambiguously assign any valid value to one and only one category.
The class of probability forecasts of yes/no events that are best described in human-readable terms
Upper bound of an interval
An interval with both lower and upper bounds.  The lower bound condition is strictly greater than.  The upper bound condition is less than or equal to.
An interval with both lower and upper bounds.  The lower bound condition is greater than or equal to.  The upper bound condition is strictly less than.
An interval with both lower and upper bounds.  The lower bound condition is greater than or equal to.  The upper bound condition is less than or equal to.
An interval with only an upper bound.  The upper bound condition is strictly less than.
An interval with only an upper bound.  The upper bound condition is less than or equal to.
An interval with only a lower bound.  The lower bound condition is strictly greater than.
An interval with only a lower bound.  The lower bound condition is greater than or equal to.
An interval with both lower and upper bounds.  The lower bound condition is strictly greater than.  The upper bound condition is strictly less than.
An event defined by the observation of falling precipitation in any form.
One or more of the following:  freezing rain or freezing drizzle, ice pellets, any form of precipitation mixed with these
One or more of the following:  rain or drizzle mixed with one or more of the following:  snow or snow grains
One or more of the following:  snow or snow grains
One or more of the following:  rain or drizzle
One or more of the following: snow or snow grains
One or more of the following: freezing rain or freezing drizzle, ice pellets, any form of precipitation mixed with these
One or more of the following:  rain, drizzle, or rain/snow mixture
